trial_identification.studytitle: Low air pressure insufflation during insertion phase of colonoscopy
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Low air pressure insufflation during insertion phase of colonoscopy on cecal intubation time

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Other diseases of the mouth, teeth, oesophagus, digestive system including liver and colon

interventions.interventions: We use low pressure air insufflation instead of high pressure during insertion phase of colonoscopy. Air insufflation is usually needed during colonoscopy. There are 3 air pressure level of air pressures on the control panel: high, median and low. Traditionaly, high pressure (0.05 MPa) is used. In this study, we use low pressure (0.0075-0.015 MPa) during insertion phase of colonoscopy to minimize loop formation. Before the colonoscopy is started, the air pressure was switched to low level on the control panel.

primaryOutcome.outcome: to reduce cecal intubation time by one minute

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: age 16 to 80 year old asymptomatic patients admitted the physical check department of our hospital.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Unwilling to sign informed consent, prevoious colectomy, allergic to buscopan, meperidine or propofol, colon obstruction, and poor preparation

sponsorship.primarysponsorname: Buddhist Dalin Tzu Chi General Hospital
sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: 2 Min-Sheng Road, Dalin, Chia-Yi 622, Taiwan, R.O.C

fundingsource.fundingname: Buddhist Dalin Tzu Chi General Hospital
fundingsource.fundingaddress: 2 Min-Sheng Road, Dalin, Chia-Yi 622, Taiwan, R.O.C

ethicsAndSummary.summary: Too much air insufllated during colonoscopy results in loop formation and patient discomfort. We conducted this study to see if low air pressure insufflation could reduce loop fromation and thus improve efficiency of colonoscopy.

ethicscommitee.ethicname: The Research Ethics Committee of Buddhist Dalin Tzu Chi General Hospital
ethicscommitee.ethicaddress: 2 Min-Sheng Road, Dalin, Chia-Yi 622, Taiwan, R.O.C
